image.altText: A single bed in a room at the new youth training centre

props.synopsis: Nearly one in two incarcerated children in South Australia have been prescribed a supplement to help them fall asleep, amid concerns about "unusual" night-time behaviours.

title.children: Almost half of SA youth detainees prescribed sleep supplement melatonin

image.altText: Crates at Adelaide Airport containing pandas.

props.synopsis: On a day expected to reach 40C, Adelaide Zoo's two new giant pandas Xing Qiu and Yi Lan have touched down, with politicians eager to talk up their diplomatic significance.

title.children: Australia's new giant pandas receive sweltering reception

image.altText: Raina Cruise leaves theÂ Adelaide District Court.

props.synopsis: A suspended sentence handed to a woman who attacked a pregnant officer outside an Adelaide pub three years ago, ripping hair from her scalp, triggers a call for mandatory jail time people convicted of assaulting SA police.

title.children: Police attacker's suspended sentence prompts push for mandatory jail for assaulting officers

image.altText: A montage of photos shows people taking pictures or shining lights into penguins burrows

props.synopsis: There are only a few little penguins left on Granite Island but they're bolder than most and researchers are keen to find out why.

title.children: Scientists explore why penguins on this island are bolder and more aggressive

image.altText: A man kneels on a soccer field and smiles at someone out of shot.

props.synopsis: At eight years old, Taylor's life was changed in an instant. In his own words, he describes how sport changed his thinking around body image and his disability.

title.children: Taylor on path to playing Para sport for Australia, and his community is all in

image.altText: alleged false cancer victim

props.synopsis: An Adelaide couple remain in custody over allegations they falsely claimed their six-year-old son was undergoing cancer treatment and received $60,000 in donations. Here's what we know.

title.children: Police allege a couple faked son's cancer to claim donations. Here's what we know

image.altText: Teenager with racing car.

props.synopsis: At least 600 kilometres from his nearest racing track, country teen Jett Zerk will train each day on his Xbox in his bedroom before heading to Bathurst.

title.children: Teen set to be one of the youngest drivers ever to hit Bathurst track

image.altText: a woman with short white hair looking fondly at the chicken she's holding in an outdoor chicken pen

props.synopsis:
Sally Goode views her pampered chickens as more than just egg providers â and she's not alone, according to research from the University of Adelaide.Â

title.children: Chooks of Cluckingham Palace prove the royal rewards of owning chickens

image.altText: Penny Wong shakes hands with Premier Li Qiang in front of a panda enclosure at Adelaide Zoo

props.synopsis: Pandas Yi Lan and Xing Qiu will touch down in Adelaide this weekend, but experts say China uses the animals as a "soft power" move politically.

title.children: South Australia's two new pandas are almost here. What are the politics behind them?

image.altText: A pregnant woman holds her stomach

props.synopsis: The South Australian Government's response to a bungle that resulted in the potential miscalculation of 1,700 pregnant women's due dates was "sub-optimal" and "inappropriately prolonged", but there was no harm caused to patients, an independent review has found.

title.children: Due date bungle was 'inappropriately prolonged' by 'sub-optimal' response, report finds

image.altText: Doreen Langham's photo on a cracked phone with lights and sirens in the background.

props.synopsis: Doreen Langham was set alight by her ex-partner in 2021 in one of Queensland's most horrific domestic violence murders. Could a warning from inside police ranks have changed the outcome?

title.children: Cracks in police record-keeping flagged before Doreen Langham's death

image.altText: A man wearing a suit looks sideways as he speaks into a microphone

props.synopsis: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says the regime change in Syria is fuelling the need to bolster the Israeli population in the region.Â

title.children: Israel plans to double its population of settlers in the occupied Golan Heights

image.altText: The sun rises through boat masts over Port Phillip Bay.

props.synopsis: Victorians are being urged to brace for what is forecast to be the hottest day in years for parts of the state, as fire authorities warning of "horrendous" conditions and a high risk of bushfires.

title.children: Fire authorities on high alert as heatwave hits parts of Victoria

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie looks into camera with a serious facial expression.

props.synopsis: Whether it's "Faux outrage" or online death threats, it's risky being a whistleblower and vested interests have a lot to answer for.

title.children: Doctors have received death threats for speaking out about colleagues

image.altText: A sign on the front of a building saying 'Genius Childcare', photographed through bars.

props.synopsis: Three Genius Childcare workers take legal action against the company over allegations it intentionally paid wages late and failed to pay them thousands of dollars in superannuation.

title.children: Workers sue Genius Childcare over alleged unpaid super, late wages

image.altText: Screenshot of a Moochies watch for sale online. The watch face shows a woman smiling with 'mum' as the contact being called.

props.synopsis: The company behind Moochies watches is in liquidation, but the devices are still being sold despite mounting complaints of SIM card issues, GPS errors and difficulties contacting the firm for refunds.

title.children: Telco ombudsman concerned 'unwitting parents' buying Moochies watches

image.altText: Rob McEwan looks over with plans for construction laid out on a desk in an office.

props.synopsis: After workers dug up two skeletons at a Hobart school's hockey field it was believed there would likely be more, with the location being an old graveyard. But the scale of what the archaeological team found was staggering â and the job of putting names to the many bones was "like a giant puzzle".

title.children: Nearly 2,000 bodies were found under a school's sporting field, in what is believed to be Australia's biggest exhumation

image.altText: Steve Smith waves his bat aggressively in celebration of a century

props.synopsis: Steve Smith has been trying everything to rediscover his form, and in the end it took a return to the method that launched his career to bring about his breakthrough Gabba ton.

title.children: The tiny tweak that allowed Steve Smith to rediscover himself

image.altText: Four magic mushrooms in an outstretched hand close-up.

props.synopsis: The discovery of a close relative of the world's most popular psychedelic fungus suggests magic mushrooms came from Africa about 1.5 million years ago.

title.children: Magic mushroom discovery might explain how species spread worldwide

image.altText: Piles of corrugated and sheet metal surrounded by chunks of wood on the ground and stripped structures and trees

props.synopsis: The tropical storm is the worst to hit the French territory of Mayotte in the Indian Ocean in 90 years.

title.children: Cyclone Chido hits France's Mayotte archipelago killing 'several hundred' to possibly thousands

image.altText: A young woman and an older man stand in a field.

props.synopsis: When journalist Danielle O'Neal revisited a sugar cane farm at the centre of a UFO media storm in the 1960s, she never could have predicted the scar tissue she would find.

title.children: Investigating a UFO mystery spanning 60 years

image.altText: US troops carrying gunswalk towards a combat vehicle flying an American flag.

props.synopsis: The United States, Russia, TÃ¼rkiye and Iran are among the key global players with a foothold in Syria. This is what they potentially stand to gain, or lose, from Assad's downfall.

title.children: The state of play for global powers in Syria after Assad's fall

image.altText: Former deputy premier Troy Grant, former siege hostage Louisa Hope and former police officer Ben Besant together cafe behind

props.synopsis: It is 10 years today since a lone-wolf gunman walked into the Lindt Cafe and took 18 people hostage, demanding politicians declare Australia was under attack from Islamic State.

title.children: 'Miraculous I didn't die that day': Lindt Cafe siege 10 years on

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 is priced to fall another 0.5% on top of last week's 1.5% decline. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.Â

title.children: ASX set to slide after Wall Street rally stalls

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASIC to sue banking giant HSBC over failure to protect customers from scam texts and calls
ASX slide set to continue after Wall Street closes flat

image.altText: Blurred Graffiti under bridge in Sefton

props.synopsis: NSW Police are investigating the "offensive graffiti" that appeared under a bridge in Sefton after receiving reports about 9:40am on Sunday.

title.children: Islamophobic graffiti in Sydney's west condemned as 'disgusting', 'gutless'

image.altText: A red and blue oil tanker split in two with the vessel's bow pointing vertically up out of dark sea water

props.synopsis: Russia has opened two criminal investigations into potential safety violations after at least one person died and another tanker was significantly damaged in the weather.

title.children: Russian oil tanker split in half and sinks in storm in the Black Sea

image.altText: Hilton Cartwright taken from field in a neck brace after suffering an injury during a BBL match.

props.synopsis: Hilton Cartwright is stretchered off the ground after sustaining a possible neck injury during the Scorchers' run chase in Perth.Â

title.children: Veteran Stars all-rounder sent to hospital after fielding mishap in BBL opener

image.altText: A carved emu egg featuring a dragon backlit by a blue light.

props.synopsis: Stavros Margaritis has been carving emu eggs for decades and displaying them in his gun-shop-turned art gallery in St George. Now his daughter is embracing the family art.

title.children: Passion for intricate emu egg carving shines through another generation

image.altText: A stern looking Donald Trump waves as he walks onto city street

props.synopsis: US network ABC News will pay $US15 million ($23 million) towards Trump's presidential library to settle a lawsuit over an inaccurate on-air assertion about the president-elect's civil case with E Jean Carroll.Â

title.children: US network agrees to $23 million settlement in Trump defamation lawsuit

image.altText: A man in a black blazer with wire frame glasses sits

props.synopsis: Isak Andic, 71, was hiking with relatives when he fell 100 metres from a cliff near Barcelona, police said.

title.children: Founder of Spanish fashion brand Mango dies after 100m cliff fall

image.altText: Two sitting figures are seen in silhouette against the ocean and last light of the setting sun.

props.synopsis: Australians on the front line of climate change are fighting to save their vanishing ancestral home. Can a landmark lawsuit against the federal government save their way of life?

title.children: Life on a sinking island on Australia's northern fringe

image.altText: Max Giuliani, Luke Hobson and Lucas Henveaux on the medal podium at world short course championships.

props.synopsis: Max Giuliani wins a silver medal in the men's 200m freestyle to cap off Australia's campaign at the world short course championships in Budapest.Â

title.children: Giuliani gives Aussie swim team silver lining at world short course champs

image.altText: Two men wearing black clothes and big gold chains look sideways, one has a concerned expression

props.synopsis: A woman who accused rappers Jay-Z and Sean "Diddy" Combs of sexually assaulting her when she was 13 at an awards show after-party acknowledges certain inconsistencies in her story.

title.children: Woman accusing Jay-Z, Diddy of sexual assault acknowledges inconsistencies
